article.title: Northrop Grumman Awarded Army Biometric Intelligence Resource Contract
article.author: Katie Packard
article.text: Northrop Grumman has been awarded a $36.9 million cost-plus-award-fee contract from the U.S. Army to enhance the capabilities of the Biometric Intelligence Resource system, which uses biometric data such as fingerprints, facial recognition or iris scans to identify and track individuals of interest in the Global War on Terrorism.
